sub_topic: Applying the Fourier transform to image processing
message_1: Suppose we have an image with dimensions of 512 x 512 pixels. Apply the two-dimensional Fourier transform to the image and calculate the magnitude spectrum. How many complex numbers are contained within the resulting magnitude spectrum?
message_2:
When you apply the two-dimensional Fourier transform to an image with dimensions of 512 x 512 pixels, you will obtain a transformed image of the same dimensions, i.e., 512 x 512. Each element in the transformed image will be a complex number. Therefore, the resulting magnitude spectrum will contain:

512 x 512 = 262,144 complex numbers.
